result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court notes 8 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Maintain employment.
-Any additional programming that the Agent believes is appropriate.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Alex Andrea DF: Jesse Kenneth Shaw appeared from jail. Case called at 12:03. Includes 16CF14,16CM157. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 4  in  16CF14 and pleads G to 16CM157. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 4  in 16CF14 and 16CM157. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 , 2, 3 in 16CF14. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
On 16CF14 Court imposes
- 20 days St. Croix County Jail
  credit for 16 days credit for time served.
- $23.95  restitution
  Apply bond on file. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
  Convert Costs and DNA to a civil judgment. 

On 16CM157
Court orders Sentence W/H
Court notes 8 days credit against ultimate sentence. 
1 year probation with conditions
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
  - Restitution of $1038.14
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This  prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Maintain employment. 
- Any additional programming that agent believes appropriate. 

  All costs to be paid during probation.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, DA: Michael Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Jesse Kenneth Shaw appeared from jail. Includes 16CF14 and 16CM157 (RW). Court notes Defendant turned himself in this morning. DA Nieskes states Defendant is on probation and has other charges in Peppin and Pierce County and is requesting $1000.00 CB, Atty Andrea argues. QUASH WARRANT. Court questions on non-appearance, he was in custody in Anoka County. Atty Andrea is requesting a furlough until Friday June 2nd, DA Nieskes argues.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2017 at 11:30 am.

***AMENDED***

Includes 16CF14 and 16CM157 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, New Richmond WalMart or St. Croix Harley Davidson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Per EJL 5/31/17 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
